raw_text: SOUS CHEF       Summary     Current General Manager of Jersey Mike's in Boca Park. I strive to make every business I'm employed by succeed beyond expectations. Since becoming GM, over the past 15 months, I have increased sales by over 30%.    Bartender with more than 4 years experience in a nightclub bar setting. Driven to provide guests with exceptional service and genuine hospitality.    I'm also a talented Sous chef 7 of the 11 years of cooking. Started at the beginning of college, at the bottom as a dishwasher. Quickly moved up ranks until I was managing my own lunches, my own staff members under me, and enjoyed since. Successful at consistently delivering the highest quality food and service. I go the extra mile for any employer I work for. Let me craft that into a story:

From Dishes to Management: A Culinary Journey

Starting at just 14.5 years old, this ambitious professional began their career journey with a simple job washing dishes. Little did they know this humble beginning would lead to an impressive career spanning culinary arts, bartending, and business management.

While pursuing a Business Administration degree at Appalachian State University, they mastered the art of balancing multiple roles - working 40 hours in kitchens while bartending an additional 20 hours weekly. Their dedication to both education and work demonstrated an extraordinary work ethic that would become their trademark.

Their culinary journey truly began at their first restaurant job, where they quickly climbed from dishwasher to Sous Chef. Under the mentorship of world-renowned chefs like Julius Kalman, they developed exceptional knife skills and a passion for creating unique daily specials. A highlight of their culinary career came in 2013 when their team placed third in the NC Fire on the Rock competition, where they had to prepare a four-course meal for 150 guests using secret North Carolina ingredients.

The story isn't just about cooking though. Their experience in high-energy environments like college bars and sports bars helped develop outstanding multitasking abilities and people skills. One particular establishment they recall fondly as "the best experience of my college years," where they managed both kitchen duties and bartending while handling everything from wing nights to dart league competitions.

Their journey even took them internationally, with a stint in Melbourne, Australia, showcasing their adventurous spirit and adaptability.

Today, they serve as the General Manager of Jersey Mike's in Boca Park, where they've demonstrated their business acumen by increasing sales by over 30% in just 15 months. Armed with ServSafe certification, TAM Card, and Food Handler's Card, they continue to drive excellence in food service and business management.

Their story is one of continuous growth, unwavering dedication, and a genuine passion for the food service industry. As they proudly note, they've never been fired in their life - a testament to their strong work ethic and commitment to excellence.

Despite the demands of their current role, they still have plans to complete their BSBA at UNLV, showing that their journey of personal and professional growth continues to evolve.
